::Reptilica/Bloodystrike::

Reptilica and Bloodystrike glance at each other, not quite getting 
who she was talking about.

"Hmm.. No, I can't say I know who that is," Reptilica says, turning a 
corner and heading for the mess hall.






--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> * Desmonus rolles her optics as she openly sees Both Bloodystrike 
and 
> Reptilica look at her swinging hips. Still puzzled at how they can 
be 
> entertained so easily.
> But, she guessed that that was just the way that these two were.
> If all men were like that, slag help them all.
> But these too looked simple minded.
> 
> But ever so fainly, as Reptilica pointed down the wron g direction 
and was 
> rudly corrected bt Bloodystrike, she wondered if the Maximals were 
ever this 
> stupid?
> None of them seemed like it, in fact, they all seemed to be rather 
clever. 
> But then why were they losing this war?
> Their kind ways, which is basically weak not only in her own views, 
but 
> everyone elses.
> Hmm...but some of the Maximals soldiers didn't seem so peaceful.
> Like the reptilien warrior she had seen back in that clearing, the 
> transmetal 2 which she had sensed held the mech fluid she kept 
hungering 
> for.
> But it was the first time she had ever sensed fluid so strong 
before, not 
> even knowing until now that it existed.
> Desmonus' stomach growled at the thought, hissing through her teeth.
> She would have that fluid, but first she would have to get the bot 
who it 
> belonged to.
> Perhaps reprogram him into an Alliance member, so that he would 
always be 
> around when hunger struck.
> But unlike these two, she would not have to give any sense of 
primitive 
> pleasure just to feed, she could just take it.
> Desmonus smiled, she liked that idea.
> 
> Desmonus suddenly shook her head to clear it, feeling Reptilica 
trying to 
> slip an arm around her, hissing but allowing him to do so.
> Mostly annoyed at breaking her train of thought.
> Then Bloodystrike trying to slip his arm around her as well.
> But she put on a smile.*
> 
> " Yesss, we shall. But...a question while we walk: I saw a 
Transmetal 2 in a 
> clearing once, batting against one of our soldiers, Oblitertron."
> 
> * In order to capture and perhaps reprogram that bot, she might as 
well 
> learn his name."
> 
> " Hmm...silver armor, hard, mean features. Reptiliean, skilled. 
What is his 
> name...if you know?"
> 
> 
> 
>
